channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Prismer: A Vision-Language Model with An Ensemble of Experts
item.description: Recent vision-language models have shown impressive multi-modal generation capabilities.

item.title: LLaMA: Open and Efficient Foundation Language Models
item.description: We introduce LLaMA, a collection of foundation language models ranging from 7B to 65B parameters.

item.title: OpenICL: An Open-Source Framework for In-context Learning
item.description: However, the implementation of ICL is sophisticated due to the diverse retrieval and inference methods involved, as well as the varying pre-processing requirements for different models, datasets, and tasks.

item.title: Unleashing Text-to-Image Diffusion Models for Visual Perception
item.description: In this paper, we propose VPD (Visual Perception with a pre-trained Diffusion model), a new framework that exploits the semantic information of a pre-trained text-to-image diffusion model in visual perception tasks.

item.title: GLIGEN: Open-Set Grounded Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Large-scale text-to-image diffusion models have made amazing advances.

item.title: The Forward-Forward Algorithm: Some Preliminary Investigations
item.description: The aim of this paper is to introduce a new learning procedure for neural networks and to demonstrate that it works well enough on a few small problems to be worth further investigation.

item.title: Discovering faster matrix multiplication algorithms with reinforcement learning
item.description: Particularly relevant is the case of 4 × 4 matrices in a finite field, where AlphaTensor’s algorithm improves on Strassen’s two-level algorithm for the first time, to our knowledge, since its discovery 50 years ago2.

item.title: Zeroth-Order Optimization Meets Human Feedback: Provable Learning via Ranking Oracles
item.description: In this paper, we focus on a novel optimization problem in which the objective function is a black-box and can only be evaluated through a ranking oracle.

item.title: MobileBrick: Building LEGO for 3D Reconstruction on Mobile Devices
item.description: The distinct data modality offered by high-resolution RGB images and low-resolution depth maps captured on a mobile device, when combined with precise 3D geometry annotations, presents a unique opportunity for future research on high-fidelity 3D reconstruction.

item.title: Prompt, Generate, then Cache: Cascade of Foundation Models makes Strong Few-shot Learners
item.description: Our CaFo incorporates CLIP's language-contrastive knowledge, DINO's vision-contrastive knowledge, DALL-E's vision-generative knowledge, and GPT-3's language-generative knowledge.

item.title: Dropout Reduces Underfitting
item.description: Additionally, we explore a symmetric technique for regularizing overfitting models - late dropout, where dropout is not used in the early iterations and is only activated later in training.

item.title: Adding Conditional Control to Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Moreover, training a ControlNet is as fast as fine-tuning a diffusion model, and the model can be trained on a personal devices.

item.title: Efficient Teacher: Semi-Supervised Object Detection for YOLOv5
item.description: The Pseudo Label Assigner prevents the occurrence of bias caused by a large number of low-quality pseudo labels that may interfere with the Dense Detector during the student-teacher mutual learning mechanism, and the Epoch Adaptor utilizes domain and distribution adaptation to allow Dense Detector to learn globally distributed consistent features, making the training independent of the proportion of labeled data.

item.title: T2I-Adapter: Learning Adapters to Dig out More Controllable Ability for Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: The incredible generative ability of large-scale text-to-image (T2I) models has demonstrated strong power of learning complex structures and meaningful semantics.

item.title: UDAPDR: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation via LLM Prompting and Distillation of Rerankers
item.description: After that, a much less expensive one is used to create large numbers of synthetic queries, which are used to fine-tune a family of reranker models.

item.title: Hyena Hierarchy: Towards Larger Convolutional Language Models
item.description: Recent advances in deep learning have relied heavily on the use of large Transformers due to their ability to learn at scale.

item.title: StyleGAN-T: Unlocking the Power of GANs for Fast Large-Scale Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: Text-to-image synthesis has recently seen significant progress thanks to large pretrained language models, large-scale training data, and the introduction of scalable model families such as diffusion and autoregressive models.

item.title: Image as Set of Points
item.description: Context clusters (CoCs) view an image as a set of unorganized points and extract features via simplified clustering algorithm.

item.title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: By decomposing the image formation process into a sequential application of denoising autoencoders, diffusion models (DMs) achieve state-of-the-art synthesis results on image data and beyond.

item.title: Factuality Enhanced Language Models for Open-Ended Text Generation
item.description: In this work, we measure and improve the factual accuracy of large-scale LMs for open-ended text generation.
